intro: Dicerandra linearis, commonly known as the linear dicerandra, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
